intro: Raddia biformis, commonly known as the two-lobed raddia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Raddia biformis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
